findings.title: Use of assembly
findings.description: The contracts xGDAO, Address, and PoolShareGovernanceToken use inline assembly which can increase the risk of vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Different versions of Solidity used
findings.description: The audit report finds different versions of Solidity used across various contracts and libraries.

findings.title: Missing 'require' checks for input parameters
findings.description: Some “require” checks are missing for the input parameter in the xGDAO contract.

findings.title: Lack of events for state changes
findings.description: Events should be fired with all state variable updates as good practice to make the contract future proof for usage in frontend applications and event listener backend services.

findings.title: Non-compliance with solidity style guide
findings.description: Different versions of Solidity are used and pragma versions are not locked.

findings.title: No Natspecs comments for functions
findings.description: Add Natspecs comments to all functions for a better understanding regarding what the parameters mean and what the function does.

findings.title: Inconsistent use of uint and uint256
findings.description: The uint256 at the time of declaration with no value gets assigned to 0 and redundant assignment to 0 results in more gas usage.
